wikipedia_page.main: Stanley James Warmington (16 December 1884 – 10 May 1941), or just S. J. Warmington, was an English actor who appeared on film, stage, radio, and television in the early 20th century.

response: * S. J. Warmington (1884-1941), British actor in the early 20th century

link_mentions.page: Index of World War II articles (S)

response: The radio series Inspector Hornleigh Investigates was devised by Hans Priwin and Hornleigh was played by S. J. Warmington. The series ran on the BBC's National station from 1937 to 1940, as one element in the 50-minute show Monday Night at Seven. Each week Inspector Hornleigh interrogates various witnesses, one of whom makes some slip that incriminates him. Listeners were invited to match their wits against Hornleigh's by identifying the criminal. The mistake made by the witness is not disclosed until the end of the programme.

In 1941, the actor S. J. Warmington who lived at number 39, died when his neighbourhood was showered with incendiary bombs, after he went out to help extinguish fires and was killed when a high-explosive bomb fell. CWGC Casualty Record, Kensington Metropolitan Borough.
